comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I wonder if this was taken by the same photographer (Ted Hood) who did this six months earlier - www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/3447212244/

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The steam paddle wheel horse / vehicle ferry (between Dawes Point and Milsons Point) could be either the 'Benelon' 1885 - www.ferriesofsydney.com/benelon.html or the 'Barangaroo' 1889 - www.ferriesofsydney.com/barangaroo.html

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Thanks for adding these links, beachcomberaustralia - particularly the one describing Ted Hood hanging upside down to take his photograph! 

It's hard to say who took the images in this series as they are uncredited.
